answer.explanation: Good morning. I called this meeting to discuss how all cashiers at our store should interact with customers. I’ve noticed that some of you are so focused on scanning items and getting people through the line quickly, that you’re ignoring the customers. We want to leave customer at our supermarket with good impression, so it’s crucial that you greet them. Be sure to be pleasant when they arrive at your cash register. I’m now going to have you work in pairs to play the part of the cashier and customer to practice being friendly, while also being fast and efficient.

answer.explanation: W-Br: Hi, it's your neighbor, Indira. My return flight was scheduled to leave in an hour and they just announced it’s been canceled. I'm standing in line right now, waiting to talk to a ticket agent. I'm so tired of traveling, but it looks like I won’t make it home this evening —I think the next flight's in the morning . Can you believe it? Anyway, I have a favor to ask. Could you go by my house after work? A package was supposed to arrive today, and l’d rather it didn’t just sit in front of my door overnight. I really appreciate it!

answer.explanation: Welcome to the Hoffman Textiles Facto tour. As most of you know, our factory provides quality fabrics to clothing manufacturers around the world. During the tour of the facility, you'll see the care that goes into making each of our many types of fabrics. Now, normally we’d start by showing you how fabric is made on the weaving machines, but another tour group is still in that area. So today we’ll start in the final packaging room and do the tour in reverse, visiting the weaving machines at the end. Then we can offer you a 10% discount on fabric purchases today only.

answer.explanation: In local news, Westcot Railway officials have revealed a plan for a new railway line to be installed between the capital city, Milton, and the popular tourist destination Greenview City. Construction on the project is scheduled to begin at the end of this year. According to the announcement, railway cars on the new line will offer travelers more comfortable seats for the twelve-hour train ride. The Travel and Tourism Association has already voiced its strong support for the new railway line. Jackie Hall, spokesperson for the association, says tourism professionals are happy to see this much-needed upgrade and anticipate a boost to their industry.

question.text: According to the news report, what will happen at the end of the year?
choices: (A) A tourist resort will be renovated.
(B) An airline merger will take place.
(C) Construction on a new railway line will begin.
(D) A hotel association will select a new president.

answer.explanation: Welcome to this morning's seminar for freelance writers. So let’s go over some administrative details. As you know, the parking fee was included in your registration, so I have passes for everyone. I'll come around and hand those out now. Just show it to the attendant on your way out and you won’t be charged.

answer.explanation: OK, the next topic I want to discuss is staffing. answer.explanation: Welcome to the new employee orientation at Tockney Nature Center. We’re happy that you'll be guiding our bird-watching tours! Behind me there’s a trail map of the Nature Center. We'll be walking down trail two so I can show you some interesting spots to take visitors. You can use the other trails as well, except for this trail right here because there’s family of bald eagles nesting nearby. For the first time, the Center collaborating with the state university on a research project about eagles. question.text: Who is the talk intended for?

question.text: The travel _____ will be processed as soon as they are received.

answer.explanation:
Before the blank we have cluster "the travel", the following can cluster up from "will be processed"
=> "The travel " is the subject
The + Noun phrase -> C,D are wrong
Based on the side: as soon as THEY ARE received ”
=> choose B

question.text: _____  change your seating assignment, visit the reservations page on our Web site.

answer.explanation:
After the blank, we have "change" - V infinitive
- For + V- ing / N oun
- Across / With + Noun
- To + V
=> D

question.text: The president of Somchai Bank rides  _____ bicycle to work every day, except when it rains.

answer.explanation:
Between the blank, we have "rides" (verb) and "bicycle" (Noun)
- We need a possessive adjective

question.text: Agents who have not yet registered for next week’s Insurance Excellence Forum must do so  _____.

=>D

question.text: Matos Realty has developed two  _____  methods of identifying undervalued properties.

Before N is an adjective
=> A

question.text: Wearing lab coats and safety goggles is a  _____  for all laboratory workers.

=>D

question.text: The manufacturer  _____  that the filter be cleaned at least once a month for optimal performance.

=>C

question.text: Before selecting a Dagle steel door, measure the door opening  _____.

answer.explanation:
Before the blank, we have Verb "opening" in the form of V- ing
We have an adverb that usually comes before / after the verb to modify verbs

question.text: Okpara employees should contact their supervisors by 10:00 A.M  _____  they expect to miss a day of work.

=>A

question.text: The director has requested a  _____  costs of short- and long-term agreements.

answer.explanation: a / an / the + nouns

question.text: Ms. Yi of Lakesview Catering says that five trays of appetizers are more than  _____for fifty  guests.

=>D

question.text: Canada s Pan Rail Corporation will no longer  _____ freight into the United States.

answer.explanation:
In front of the blank is the verb "will" + adverb "no longer", followed by the noun "freight"
The blank needs the Verb Because Will + V / adverb + V

question.text: According to experts, Flash Maxe dishwashing detergent consistently delivers   _____  results.

answer.explanation:
Before the blank we have the verb "delivers", followed by the noun "results"
Before a noun is an adjective that modify the noun before it

question.text: When picking up identification badges, employees need to show  _____  of employment at Ekmekci Associates.

=>C

question.text: Roxy Koenig is_____  seeking a new venue for her summer concert since the Hazelton Music Hall is being renovated.

Before blank there is tobe- "is", behind the void is the verb V-ing "seeking".

question.text:
To: jaredkho@pharmacon.com.au
From: angelazucker@umedvic.edu.au
Date: 22 June
Subject: Thanks!

Dear Dr. Kho,
Thanks for (1) ______ our laboratory yesterday. As always, your expertise (2) ______. Our technicians especially benefited from your demonstration of the updated imaging systems, as well as from the general discussion of principles behind the technological advances in the lab setting.
Over the next few months, I will be hiring several more technicians. Would (3) ______ be available to lead another session in October? (4) ______ . Please let me know so we can discuss the details.

Sincerely,
Angela Zucker
Thanks for (1) ______ our laboratory yesterday.

answer.explanation: Weigh in below with the word demonstration ie instruction, vision => Mr. Kho was visiting the lab yesterday to show him => Answer C is appropriate

question.text: As always, your expertise (2) ______.

answer.explanation: We see talking about events in the past, the expertise of Dr. The warehouse is so respected, it needs a passive structure => Answer D satisfies both

question.text: Would (3) ______ be available to lead another session in October?

answer.explanation: We see behind the verb "be", so we need to choose the subject pronoun => Eliminate A, B. And the writer is asking Dr. The repository has free time, so answer C is suitable

question.text: (4) ______ . Please let me know so we can discuss the details.
choices: (A) Many of the candidates seem very promising.
(B) If so, it would be a great help to the new employees.
(C) With your input, the process will be quick.
(D) These technicians adhere to strict regulations.

answer.text: (B) If so, it would be a great help to the new employees.
answer.explanation: This sentence needs to be merged with the previous and next sentence. The previous question is asking whether Dr. Can Warehouse conduct another session and the following sentence is still related to this => the middle sentence is also related. Answer B (If so, that would be a huge help for new hires) is appropriate

question.text:
BRENTON (March 22) – Yesterday, Brenton Railway won a $37 million grant from the Federal Transit Agency. Thanks to the (1) ______, construction of the proposed train terminal in Kirk Valley can now begin.
The expansion of the rail system is certainly good news for many in the community. (2) ______. Drivers, too, are pleased about the grant. Edgar Simental (3) ______ lives near the planned Kirk Valley Station, says “What a relief for commuters like me. We have had to endure steadily worsening road traffic (4) ______ some time now. I anticipate taking the train instead of my car to work every day as soon as the station opens.”
Thanks to the (1) ______, construction of the proposed train terminal in Kirk Valley can now begin.

answer.explanation: The previous sentence is about the project that received a 37 million dollar grant  Thanks to this money/fund, construction was able to begin. => A grant is funding.

question.text: The expansion of the rail system is certainly good news for many in the community. (2) ______.
choices: (A) Riders will no longer be able to park their cars at the terminal.
(B) Officials have confirmed that construction has been postponed indefinitely.
(C) The cost of a monthly train pass, however, is expected to increase.
(D) The project will create about 75 permanent jobs at the station.

answer.text: (D) The project will create about 75 permanent jobs at the station.
answer.explanation: Only answer D. The project will create about 75 additional permanent station jobs. Good news

question.text: Drivers, too, are pleased about the grant. Edgar Simental (3) ______ lives near the planned Kirk Valley Station, says “What a relief for commuters like me.

answer.explanation: This place requires the relation clause to supplement Edgiar Sinental who points to answer D

question.text: We have had to endure steadily worsening road traffic (4) ______ some time now.

answer.explanation: We see that only for + period is appropriate here, that is, we have suffered from worsening traffic patterns for a period of time.

question.text:
To: Joseph Blum - jblum@serenlakerestaurant.net
From: Charlie Timmer- ctimmer@Serenelakeres,aurant.net
Re: Outstanding reviews
Date: April 2

Dear Josephine,
The other managers and I were pleased to read the recent glowing reviews in both the Gazette Daily Press and the Downtowner. We agree that your contributions to Serene Lake Restaurant have been (1) ______. Therefore, we are happy (2) ______ you a bonus that will be paid with your next weekly paycheck on April 8.
(3) ______ , we are raising your salary by 10 percent, effective May 1. Since you began as Executive Chef in December, our sales have more than doubled. (4) ______. These positive trends are directly linked to your stellar performance.

Many thanks from the management team of Serene Lake Restaurant.
Charlie
We agree that your contributions to Serene Lake Restaurant have been (1) ______.

answer.explanation: Translating the 4 answers we see D. Excellent is the best match. (A is indifferent, B is suitable, C is cheap, can be bought).

question.text: Therefore, we are happy (2) ______ you a bonus that will be paid with your next weekly paycheck on April 8.

answer.explanation: Grammatical structure: S + be + adj + to V- answer A is correct.

question.text: (3) ______ , we are raising your salary by 10 percent, effective May 1.

answer.explanation: Above is for a bonus, underneath a raise => In addition to that be appropriate.

question.text: Since you began as Executive Chef in December, our sales have more than doubled. (4) ______.
choices: (A) An assistant manager will be hired as soon as possible.
(B) The restaurant will be open late on weekends beginning next month.
(C) You are the only staff member who will receive a raise this year.
(D) Our ratings in local magazines have also risen significantly.

answer.text: (D) Our ratings in local magazines have also risen significantly.
answer.explanation: To talk about postive trends, the first idea is that sales have doubled, second point must also talk about a good trend  answer D. Ranking in local magazines has also increased significantly.

question.text: Education Fair (9 July)-The annual International Higher Education Fair came to Jakarta for the third consecutive year on Saturday, 7 July. (1) _______. As usual, American and Australian universities were (2) ______ represented. (3) ______ , observers noted that participation from European and Asian universities has been increasing year by year. Also noticeable was the fact that many more graduate students attended the (4) ______ this year than in the past.
(9 July)-The annual International Higher Education Fair came to Jakarta for the third consecutive year on Saturday, 7 July. (1) _______.
choices: (A) A teachers’ conference was also held at the same hotel.
(B) The fair featured hundreds of institutions from all over the world.
(C) Local student organizations arranged the evening entertainment.
(D) Registration fees were waived for those who volunteered to work at the fair.

answer.text: (B) The fair featured hundreds of institutions from all over the world.
answer.explanation: The first sentence tells about the event that took place 3, logically you will have to add more information about the event, and logically with the following paragraph tells about the university => answer B. The work has been recorded attracts hundreds of educational training agencies around the world.

question.text: As usual, American and Australian universities were (2) ______ represented.

answer.explanation: Before represent verb represent adverb

question.text: (3) ______ , observers noted that participation from European and Asian universities has been increasing year by year.

answer.explanation: This sentence provides additional information from Moreover, Moreover, also is correct.

question.text: Also noticeable was the fact that many more graduate students attended the (4) ______ this year than in the past.

answer.explanation: This is an event, not class, demonstration or ceremony

question.text:
TSL Laptop Loan Program

Patrons of Tartan Street Library (TSL) can now take advantage of our laptop loan program. Thanks to a donation from the Lynquire Corporation, we now have 25 new laptop computers available for in-house use only. The equipment can be rented once daily at our service counter for a fee of $3.00 per hour with a maximum loan period of two hours. Patrons can use the library’s wireless printer for a charge of $0.15 per page.
Please Note: TSL employees can assist with general start-up procedures for the laptops and with wireless Internet and printer connections. However they are unable to provide any assistance with technical difficulties users may experience involving either the laptop itself or anpy computer program being used.
What is stated about the Tartan Street Library’s laptop computers?
choices: (A) They can be borrowed at no charge.
(B) They can be used only within the building.
(C) They are owned by the Lynquire Corporation.
(D) They can be rented three times per day.

answer.text: (B) They can be used only within the building.
answer.explanation:
In the reading of this important information is underlined
(paragraph 1 of line 4) "for in-house use only" (used only
within the building.
=> The correct project is sentence B.

question.text: According to the notice, what are TSL employees unable to do for laptop users?

answer.explanation:
The answer to this sentence appears in paragraph 2, and we can track it down by searching for keyword "unable" (paragraph 2, line 3, starting with "However") This information looks like this: Of course, they (TSL employees) cannot also provide any support for the technical problems a user might encounter either about the computer itself or the computer program being used.
=> The correct answer is question D.

question.text:
Blank & Cassell Office Supplies

55 Belmont Street, Denver, CO 80252

Phone: 720-555-0101

www.blanckandcassell.com

October 4
Elena Cardillo
124 Sagebrush Avenue, Apartment B3
Denver, CO 80033

Dear Ms. Cardillo:
To thank you for being such a loyal customer, we would like to invite you to become a member of our new Frequent Buyer Club. It is free to join and will help you save money on future purchases. Once enrolled, you will receive a 5 percent discount on all purchases in our Denver and Boulder stores. The only requirement for maintaining your membership is to make at least one purchase per year.
To sign up, simply complete and send in the enclosed form or visit our Web site at www.blanckandcassell.com.

Sincerely,
Isaac Grantway
Customer Service Representative
Enclosure
Why was the letter sent to Ms. Cardillo?
choices: (A) To announce an update to a Web site

answer.explanation: The information appears in the first paragraph of the letter, line 3 (once registered ... Boulder stores: once you are enrolled, you will receive a 5% discount on all purchases you make at our stores. Denver and Boulder => The correct answer is question B

question.text: What was sent with the letter?

answer.explanation: When writing email, to attach something, the author will use 1 enclosed word, 2 is attached word. We just need to find these two words in the article. And in this letter, we find the word enclosed in paragraph 2: the enclosed form (application form is attached) => The correct answer is D

question.text:
To: Sales Associates Team
From: Shein, Clifford
Date: November 22
Subject: Urgent matter

Dear Sales Associates,
The most recent edition at The Brooktown Weekly ran our advertisement with a misprint. It listed the end of our half-price sale as December 11 instead of December 1. While a correction will appear in the paper's next issue, it is to be expected that not all of our customers will be aware of the error. Therefore, if shoppers ask between December 2 and 11 about the sale, first apologize for the inconvenience and then offer them a coupon for 10닷 off any item they wish to purchase, either in the store or online.
Should customers have any further questions, please direct them to the floor manager. Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

Clifford Shein, General Manager, Williams Apparel
What is stated about The Brooktown Weekly?
choices: (A) It runs advertisements by Williams Apparel in every edition.
(B) It misidentified the last day of Williams Apparel’s promotional event.
(C) It will include discount coupons from Williams Apparel in its next edition.
(D) It apologized to the general manager of Williams Apparel for an inconvenience.

answer.text: (B) It misidentified the last day of Williams Apparel’s promotional event.
answer.explanation:
The response to this sentence appeared on the first two lines of the letter: "The Brooktown weekly's most recent issue ran our ad with a misprinted information. It shows the end date. The end of the half-price sale is on December 11 instead of December 1.

=> The correct answer is B

question.text: What does Mr. Shein ask the sales associates to do?
choices: (A) Refer customers to the company’s Web site for additional products
(B) Refer customers to the store’s advertisement in local newspapers
(C) Tell customers to discuss additional concerns with a supervisor
(D) Tell customers about a problem with a new product

answer.text: (C) Tell customers to discuss additional concerns with a supervisor
answer.explanation:
In this article in paragraph 2, we see the appearance of the word please. Read this whole question: If the customer has any further questions, direct them to the floor manager.

=> The correct answer is question C

question.text:
Auckland Daily Chronicle

Business Briefs

AUCKLAND (6 June) - Ann Marie Haas, former executive director of Gear Good, a company that develops and sells software for bike-sharing companies, has a new but related position. —[1]—. Beginning in November, she will be general manager of City Wheels, a bike-sharing company in Auckland. — [2]—. The move comes at an opportune moment for both Ms. Haas and City Wheels. Ms. Haas had worked for Gear Good in Wellington since the company was founded five years ago but was yearning to return to Auckland, where she grew up. City Wheels was looking for a new leader to oversee its planned expansion from 50 to 75 bike stations in Auckland. —[3] —. “I’m thrilled to join a company that’s important to residents and tourists alike,” Ms. Haas said.
The City Wheels system is simple and affordable for occasional use. —[4] —. The first thirty minutes of biking are free, and after that, the cost is $4 per hour or $20 per day. Ms. Haas said she is enthusiastic about this venture, both for herself and for the city of Auckland. - Tahei Davis, Staff Writer
What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A) To describe the financial difficulties a business is facing
(B) To announce the launch of a new software company
(C) To report on an executive's career move
(D) To assess recent tourism trends in Auckland

answer.text: (C) To report on an executive's career move
answer.explanation:
The form of information giving your topic or purpose will be in the beginning. (Paragraph 1).
We have: AUCKLAND (6/6) Ann Marie Haas, former chief operating officer of Gear Good, a company that develops and sells side parts to Bike-sharing companies, already has a A new position but is relevant to her expertise. Starting in November, she will be the general manager of city wheels, another bike-sharing company in Aukland. => The correct answer is C

question.text: What does City Wheels expect to do?

answer.explanation: “City Wheels was looking for a new leader to oversee its planned expansion from 50 to 75 bike stations in Auckland”.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2, [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“A modest $5 registration fee is required to begin using City Wheels bikes.”

answer.explanation: “A modest 5 $ registration fee is required to begin using City Wheels bike. The firs thirty minutes of biking are free, and after that, the cost is 4 $ per hour or 20 $ per day. "

question.text:

You left in such a rush. Did you manage to catch the train?

Hyuk Shin 3:55 P.M.

No, but there's another one in 10 minutes.

Claire Cha 3:57 P.M.

That's a relief. Did you send the catering invoice to Mr. Kwon before you left the office?

Hyuk Shin 3:59 P.M.

Yes, but I had to send it by express mail. The fax machine wouldn't connect.

Claire Cha 4:01 P.M.

That's OK. He'll get it by tomorrow anyway.

Hyuk Shin 4:02 P.M.

That's what I thought.

answer.explanation:
“Claire Father 3:55 PM

You left in such a rush. Did you manage to catch the train ? ”

=> Shin must be at the train station before Claire asked if she could catch the train.

question.text: Where most likely is Mr. Shin as he writes to Ms. Cha?

answer.explanation:
“Claire Cha 4:01 PM

That's OK. He'll get it by tomorrow anyway .

Hyuk Shin 4:  02 PM

That's what I thought. ”

question.text:
Anish Kumar 11:15 A.M.
Thanks everyone for getting together online before our next meeting. I thought it would be helpful to see what’s been done and what still needs to be done for the festival. I believe Ella has some news to share.
Ella Costa 11:16 A.M.
That’s right. I finally got a permit from the city council to hold the festival in Greenhill Park!
Mi-Young Park 11:17 A.M.
Fantastic!
Kenneth Baudin 11:18 A.M.
That's great news. I was worried they weren't going to come around.
Ella Costa 11:19 A.M.
When I showed them that our plans included ways to limit trash and other potential crowd-related problems, they were convinced.
Anish Kumar 11:20 A.M.
Any other news?
Mi-Young Park 11:21 A.M.
King Pizza has already agreed to park a pizza truck at the festival. I also have several calls out to other local eateries. I should have responses from some others by the time we meet on Friday.
Kenneth Baudin 11:22 A.M.
I’m still working on getting more acts to perform. Janine Dougherty has tentatively agreed to sing with a band for a few numbers.
Anish Kumar 11:23 A.M.
That would be great. She has a great voice and she’s a local favorite here.
What are the writers discussing?

answer.explanation:
Ella Costa 11:16 AM
That's right. I finally got the permit from the city council to hold the festival in Greenhill Park.

question.text: At 11:18 A.M. what does Mr. Baudin most likely mean when he writes, “I was worried they weren't going to come around”?
choices: (A) He did not think a permit would be granted.
(B) He did not think the council would attend the event.
(C) He thought the council meeting would be canceled.
(D) He thought the trash would not be removed.

answer.text: (A) He did not think a permit would be granted.
answer.explanation:
That's right. I finally got the permit from the city council to hold the festival in Greenhill Park.
That's great news. I was worried they weren't going to come around

question.text: What is Ms. Park expecting?

answer.explanation: King Pizza has already agreed to park a pizza truck at the festival. I also have several calls out to other local eateries. I should ha responses from ome others by the time we on Friday .

question.text: Who most likely is Ms. Dougherty?

answer.explanation: I'm still working on getting more acts to perform. Janine Dougherty has tentatively agreed to sing with a band for a few numbers .

question.text:
Saponac State Park


Please note that www.newengIandcxplored.com, a popular commercial tourism Web site, lists 42 Millinockct Drive as the address of Saponac State Park. Be aware that this is the address for the park’s maintenance facilities, which are located on an unpaved road that is open only to park employees. The Saponac State Park Visitor Center and the official park entrance are located at 66 Debsconeag Way, about 32 miles from the maintenance building. Park visitors must use the park’s main entrance. All marked trails and guided walks begin in this area. From Elkdale, take Highway 82 north, use exit 558 for Ranch Road, and follow the signs approximately 8 miles to the park’s main entrance. All roads leading to the park’s main entrance are paved. For more information, call (207) 555-0117.
For whom is the notice most likely intended?

answer.explanation: Park visitors must use the park's main entrance. A ll marked trails and guided walks begin in this area.

question.text: What is suggested about the Web site www.newenglandexplored.com?
choices: (C) It has information about parks in many countries.
(D) It was created by Saponac State Park employees.

answer.explanation:
Please note that

www.newenglandexplored .com, a popular                           

commercial tourism Web site lists 42 Millinocket Drive as the address of Saphonac State Park. Be aware that this is the address for the park's maintenance facilities,             

which are located on an unpaved road that is open only to park employees.

question.text: What does the notice include?
choices: (B) Directions for driving to the park
(C) A list of current roadwork projects near the park

answer.text: (B) Directions for driving to the park
answer.explanation:
From Elkdale, take Highway 82 north, use exit 558 for Ranch Road, and follow the signs                           

approximately 8 miles to the park's main entrance .

question.text:
Airport Expansion Continues

26 May – A major airport expansion project is under way in Onalia City. The project is estimated to cost $1,6 billion, and a new terminal is scheduled to open for international service in approximately one year.
The airport, however, sits on a confined piece of land, which presents significant challenges to increasing the number of takeoffs and landings. If the airport remains limited to its current two runways, the capacity to handle air traffic could be reached within three years.
To address the problem, officials overseeing the Onalia City Airport project have contracted a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the possibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean. The engineering firm will survey the area for six months before presenting their findings and recommending a plan of action.
Runways that extend over water are not unprecedented. This type of runway exists in places such as Gibraltar and Japan, which have faced similar challenges.
Why is Onalia City Airport undergoing an expansion?
choices: (A) To accommodate flights to other countries
(B) To provide service to a growing population in surrounding cities
(C) To compete with a nearby airport

answer.text: (A) To accommodate flights to other countries
answer.explanation: The project is estimated to cost $ 1.6 Billion and a new terminal is scheduled to open for international service in approximately one year.

question.text: In paragraph 2, line 5, the word “handle” is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: If the airport remains limited to its current two runway, the capacity to handle air traffic could be reached within three years.

question.text: What has Wilford Engineering been hired to do?
choices: (A) To determine whether a potential runway site is suitable
(B) To develop a plan for increasing the size of the air traffic control tower
(C) To investigate how to improve traffic on roads leading to the airport
(D) To review expansion plans with officials in Gibraltar and Japan

answer.text: (A) To determine whether a potential runway site is suitable
answer.explanation: To address the problem, officials overseeing the Onalia City Airport project have contracting a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the possibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean .

question.text: What is suggested about Onalia City Airport?
choices: (A) It has been open for one year.
(B) It has earned $1.6 billion in revenue.
(D) It  is located on the coast.

answer.text: (D) It  is located on the coast.
answer.explanation: ....a group of engineers from Wilford Engineering to explore the possibility of extending a third runway over the Pacific Ocean....

question.text:
Dubai Ecological Construction Expo

Exhibit Hall Rules

BADGE CONTROL

Admission to the exhibit hall is restricted to exhibitors from qualified companies, exposition attendees, and logistics personnel.

Badges are required on the floor at all limes, including during move-in and move-out days.
• Exhibitor badges will be given to the company’s primary contact for distribution to that exhibitor's personnel.
• The number of badges assigned to each exhibitor will be based on the size of booth space the company has rented.
• Anyone on the floor who is not officially registered will be evicted from the show.
• False certification of any individual as a company’s exhibition representative, or misuse of exhibitor badges, will be just cause for removing the exhibit from the floor.
What is the purpose of the policy statement?
choices: (B) To provide details about setting up exhibits
(C) To specify who is permitted in the exhibit hall
(D) To describe facilities that are available to participants

answer.text: (C) To specify who is permitted in the exhibit hall
answer.explanation:
Admission to the exhibit hall is restricted to exhibitors from qualified companies, exposition             

attendees, and logistics personnel.

question.text: How will individual team members obtain a badge?
choices: (A) They will receive badges from an expo official when they check in.
(B) They will print out badges directly from the expo registration Web page.
(C) Personalized badges will be sent to them in the mail.
(D) A company representative will pass badges to them.

answer.text: (D) A company representative will pass badges to them.
answer.explanation: Exhibitor badges will be given to the company's primary contact for distribution to that exhibitor personnel

question.text: What must a company do to increase the number of employees working at its exhibit?
choices: (A) Rent a larger space for its exhibit
(C) Apply for an exemption to the staff limit
(D) Speak directly to an expo representative

answer.text: (A) Rent a larger space for its exhibit
answer.explanation: The number of badges assigned to each exhibitor will be based on the size of booth space the company has rented

question.text:
To: calvin.galt@zmurk.net
From: s_duval@cps.org
Date: 2 February
Subject: Next Steps

Dear Mr.Galt,
Thank you again for agreeing to serve on the organizing committee tor the Caribbean Professional Screenwriters (CPS) Conference. I am following up on our initial meeting about speakers and presenters.
I get the impression that Timothy Primus, our first choice, may be out of our price range. However, I’ve been pursuing sonic funding in the form of government grants. If these resources come through, I'll try to secure Mr. Primus; otherwise, Laura Tambie may be a good option. In the meantime, I hope your efforts to recruit the other six panelists for the “Meet and Learn” session will be successful.

Thank you,
Shenell Duval

---------------------------------------------------

To: tprimus@egency.net
From: s_duval@cps.org
Date: 12 April
Subject: CPS Conference
Attachment: Contract

Dear Mr. Primus:
I would like to confirm your participation as the keynote speaker at the Caribbean Professional Screenwriters (CPS) Conference. You are scheduled to give your address on the opening day of the conference, Saturday, 10 July, at the Harlan Hotel in San Fernando, Trinidad. We have planned for you lo speak for 30-45 minutes. Naturally we will have technology on hand to enable you to show dips from your films, should you choose to do so. Also, please note that we request your participation at the “Meet and Learn" session which allows aspiring screenwriters an opportunity to network with industry experts This will be held on day two of the conference and will last approximately 90 minutes.
We are pleased to cover all your expenses for food, lodging, and travel both to and from San Fernando However as stated in the contract, return airfare can only be provided for those staying for and fully participating both days of the conference. To obtain flights at the most convenient times. We are recommending that tickets be secured by the end of May.
If you agree, please confirm by signing and submitting the attached contract look forward to meeting you at the conference.

Sincerely,
Shenell Duval, CPS Conference Chief Organizer
Why does Ms. Duval write to Mr. Galt?
choices: (B)  To discuss plans for an event
(D) To negotiate the terms of a contract

answer.text: (B)  To discuss plans for an event
answer.explanation: Thank you again for agreeing to serve on the organizing committee for the Caribbean Professional Screenwriters (CPS). I am following up on your initial meeting about speakers and presenters.

question.text: In the first e-mail, the word "impression” n paragraph 2. line 1. is closest in meaning

answer.explanation: I get the impression that Timothy Primus, our first choice, may be out of our price range.

question.text: What is probably true about Ms. Duval?
choices: (A) She plans to attend a job fair
(B) Her recommendations for speakers were not accepted
(C) She will meet Mr. Primus for lunch on July 10.
(D) Her application for government funding was successful.

answer.text: (D) Her application for government funding was successful.
answer.explanation:
I've been pursuing some funding in the form of government grants. If these resources come through I'll try to secure Mr.Primus
=> This is a paragraph in the first email of Ms. Duval. Next down to the second email, we see the idea is Ms. Duval wants to confirm Mr.'s participation. Primus. Since then, the pursuit of funding from the government of Ms. Duval was successful.

question.text: What is implied about Mr. Primus?
choices: (C) He has had success in the film industry
(D) He has attended a CPS conference in the past.

answer.text: (C) He has had success in the film industry
answer.explanation: We will have technology on hand to enable you to show clips from your films, should you choose to do so.

question.text: According to the second e-mail, what should Mr. Primus do to ensure that all his expenses will be paid for by CPS?
choices: (C) Finalize a travel itinerary before June 1
(D) Sign and return a reimbursement form

answer.explanation: However, as stated in the contract, return airfare can only be provided for those staying for and fully participating in both days of the conference.

question.text:
To: Ben Greenidge
From: Nirmala Deokaran
Subject: Request
Date: 13 January

Dear Mr, Greenidge.
I kindly request that management consider entering our company in the CASATO Virtual Business Tournament. The competition, organized by the Caribbean & South American Trade Organization (CASATO), requires participants to develop and implement business strategies that ensure the long-term stability and continuity or an imaginary company.
Participation in this event could be highly beneficial to our company. Though many tournament participants occupy non-decision-making positions in their organization, the contest demands that they apply a broad range of leadership practices. In the process, most become more appreciative of the day-to-day realities and complexities of managing an actual company. Moreover, they tend to apply the skills acquired or refined during the competition — such as collaboration, analysis, and problem-solving — in actual work situations. Additionally, participation in the event may increase our company’s profile, opening up new markets for our products. Roughly six months after last year’s tournament, about one-third of the 70 companies that had taken part in that event reported an increase in regional business activities.

Details about the tournament are available at wwwxasato.org/events/tournament_information.

Sincerely,
Nirmala Deokaran
Flight Dispatcher
Omicron Air Cargo

----------------------------------------------

CASATO

CASATO VIRTUAL TOURNAMENT

Entry information

Registration for this years tournament is open from 1 March to 1 April, t while the tournament starts on 8 Jun. No more than two teams per company can be registered. The top three teams will be announced on 3 July and will be honored during a ceremony to be held on 19 August at Hotel Baia Lua in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

------------------------------------------------

A Virtual Breakthrough for Omicron

9 July- The CASATO Virtual Tournament pits teams from companies based in the ( Caribbean and South America against one another to determine which one can run the most successful virtual business. While teams from various Guyana-based companies have participated in the competition since its inception, none had ever won. Last week, however, the team representing Omicron Air Cargo in this year's event learned it had earned third place in a field consisting of 109 teams, which represented 85 companies, Omicron's winning team was led by Nirmala Deokaran. The team has been honored with the CASATO Virtual Business Award
What is the goal of competitors in the CASATO tournament?
choices: (A) To develop an international trade agreement
(B) To create materials for training prospective managers
(D) To design a business Web site

question.text: What does Ms. Deokaran NOT mention as a benefit of participating in the CASATO tournament?
choices: (A) Better understanding of the tasks that managers perform
(B) Increased opportunities to invest in regional businesses
(C) Greater public awareness of a company’s offerings

answer.text: (B) Increased opportunities to invest in regional businesses

question.text: What most likely is true about Ms. Deokaran?
choices: (A) She was invited to a celebratory event.
(B) She is being considered for a managerial position.
(C) She had taken part in interactive online competitions before.
(D) She recommended implementing some management practices.

answer.text: (A) She was invited to a celebratory event.

question.text: What is indicated about Omicron Air Cargo?
choices: (A) Its services are in great demand.
(B) Its operations are located in Guyana.
(C) It will formulate new business strategies in June.
(D) It registered two teams for the CASATO tournament.

answer.text: (B) Its operations are located in Guyana.

question.text: What is indicated about the most recent CASATO tournament?
choices: (A) It was sponsored by a Brazilian hotel chain.
(B) It saw the introduction of a set of new criteria.
(C) It drew participation from more companies than last years event.
(D) It received more press coverage than last year’s tournament.

answer.text: (C) It drew participation from more companies than last years event.

question.text:
Cutlers Rare Books
36 Boyle St.
Boston, MA 02116
Dear Mr. Cutler,

I first came across Cutlers Rare Books at the Antiquarian Book Fair in California last year. After noting the high quality and wide range of our product, I decided to purchase several bodes from your online store. As I am not interested in having damaged hooks m my collection, I carefully read the descriptions of the condition before making my purchase. I was assured that the books were undamaged and in their original condition. When 1 examined the books on their arrival, I discovered that the Norris volume had been sloppily glued and rebound within the last several years.

Please contact me at your earliest convenience to discuss this disappointing situation.

Sincerely,
Roger Baskin

------------------------------------------------

@PS@/kstoeic/images/9657809_1563420606728.png@PE@

-----------------------------------------------

Cutler’s Rare Books

36 Boyle St., Boston, MA 02116

Roger Baskin
14111 Trail Ridge Dr.
Sun City West, AZ 85375

Dear Mr. Baskin,
Let me assure you that I carefully check all of our books myself before their descriptions are entered in our sales catalog, I distinctly remember examining the volume in question when it arrived and again before it was packaged for shipping to you. It is my professional opinion that the book was rebound by its original owner over 70 years ago. Therefore, the book is in its original condition by the standards of our industry.
I understand your disappointment and, to try to make it up to you, I am refunding your payment for the book by Joseph Van Liew, which you may keep with our compliments.

Thank you,
David Cutler
Why did Mr. Baskin write to Mr. Cutler?
choices: (B) To cancel a recently placed order
(C) To object to an item’s condition
(D) To inquire about a missing item

answer.text: (C) To object to an item’s condition
answer.explanation:
I carefully read the descriptions of their condition before making my purchase I             

discovered that the Norris volume had been sloppily glued and rebound within the last several years .

question.text: What book is Mr. Baskin concerned about?

answer.explanation: I discovered that the Norris volume had been sloppily glued and rebound within the last several years .

question.text: What is mentioned about Cutler’s Rare Books?
choices: (A) It does not have an online store.
(B) It does not sell illustrated books.
(C) It does not have much inventory.
(D) It does not allow product returns.

answer.text: (D) It does not allow product returns.
answer.explanation: ...to try to make it up to you, I am refunding your payment for the book by Joseph Van Liew, which you may keep with our compliments.

question.text: What is indicated in the second letter?
choices: (A) Mr. Cutler inspected the shipment himself.
(B) Mr. Baskin’s items have not been mailed yet.
(C) Mr. Baskin will receive a replacement soon.
(D) Mr. Cutler will send the book to an expert for evaluation.

answer.text: (A) Mr. Cutler inspected the shipment himself.
answer.explanation: Let me guarantee you that I carefully check all of our books myself I                           distinctly remember             examining the volume in question when it arrived and again before it was packaged for shipping to you

answer.explanation: ..... to try to make it up to you, I am refunding your payment for the book by Joseph Van Liew, which you may keep with our compliments.

question.text:
From:Kavinder Kapur, CEO, LTL
To:LTL Factory Floor Employees
Subject: Update
Date:26 November

On Tuesday, 4 December, a reporter from Asia Enterprise Monthly will be touring LTL to collect information for an article about our new textile-printing machines. An official form our public relations department will be guiding our guests through the factory. The reporter has been granted permission to speak to employees. Please feel free to respond to question that involve your day-to-day work. You should, however, refer all other inquires to the official accompanying the reporter. We encourage you review our media policy prior to the visit. You will be informed of any changes to the plans for this event.

Thank you for your cooperation.

-----------------------------------------------

From: Desmond Xueling - dxueling@aem.com.sg
To: Ravinder Kapur - rkpur@litl.co.sg
Subject: Meeting
Date: 27 November

Dear Mr. Kapur,
Due to a scheduling conflict, I have to reschedule my tour of your facility. I could visit on one of the following days and times instead: Monday morning, 3 December; Wednesday afternoon, 5 December; or Thursday afternoon, 6 December.
Also, I have spoken to our staff photographer. Per your request, she will limit her photography to the offices of the members of the management team. Rest assured that we wiil protect your company's proprietary information.
Thank you again for your time.
Desmond Xueling, Asia Enterprise Monthly

-------------------------------------------------

New Equipment a Boon for LTL

7 January

By Desmond Xucling
Tucked into a busy industrial area in Singapore, the LTL manufacturing facility is small, gray, and unassuming. But the " building’s nondescript exterior masks an abundance of color and activity inside. Early on a sunny December morning, two enormous new textile-printing machines were already churning out the largest swaths of fabric ever processed by the factory.
“Each machine is well over three meters wide,” said LTL’s Felicity Tong, who accompanied us on a tour of the factory floor. “Our machine operators are still learning to use the machines effectively, as you can see from this pile of rejected pieces, Ms. Tong remarked. “The machines are efficient, but mastering them is posing some challenges for our work crews.
The machines come with the potential for big profits. Company CEO Ravinder Kapur commented that the demand for his company’s fabrics has grown in recent years. “These machines will allow us to print on vinyl and other materials that we had lacked the resources to work with,” he said. “We’re very pleased to be able to satisfy client demand”.
What is the purpose of the memo?
choices: (A) To publicize changes to the company’s media policy
(B) To announce the purchase of new machinery
(C) To encourage staff members to read a newspaper article
(D) To provide guidelines for speaking to a Journalist

answer.text: (D) To provide guidelines for speaking to a Journalist
answer.explanation:
The reporter has been granted permission to speak to employees. Please feel free to respond to questions that involve your ^ ay-to-day work. You             

should, however, refer all other inquiries to the official accompanying the reporter.

question.text: In the memo, the word “refer” in paragraph 1, line 6. is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Please feel free to respond to questions that involve your day-to-day work. You should, however, refer all other inquiries to the official accompanying the reporter.

question.text: When did Mr Xueling most likely visit the factory?

answer.explanation: I could visit on one of the following days and times instead: Monday moring, 3 December; Wednesday afternoon, 5 December; or Thursday afternoon, 6 December .

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Tong?
choices: (C) She had her picture taken with Mr. Kapur.
(D) She interviewed employees before the Tour

answer.explanation:
The whole article did not have specific details about Ms. Tong. However, information shows that, Ms. Tong was the one who led the reporters to visit the factory: “said LTL's Felicity Tong, who accompanied us on a tour of the factory floor”
=> Ms. Tong is the person concerned about the company's foreign affairs and public relations
=> Select B

question.text: What does the article indicate about LTL?
choices: (A) Its machine operators have completed a training program.
(B) Its new machines are more reliable than the old ones.
(C) It has been losing customers in recent years.
(D) It is using fabrics that it had not used previously.

answer.text: (D) It is using fabrics that it had not used previously.
answer.explanation: These machines will allow us to print on vinyl and other materials that we had lacked the resources to work with....
